Method Detail

getStream

public InputStream getStream()
                      throws IOException
Description copied from interface: ContentStream
Get an open stream. You are responsible for closing it. Consider using something like: 
   InputStream stream = stream.getStream();
   try {
     // use the stream...
   }
   finally {
     IOUtils.closeQuietly(stream);
   }
Only the first call to getStream() or getReader() is guaranteed to work. The runtime behavior for additional calls is undefined.

Throws:
IOException

getReader

public Reader getReader()
                 throws IOException
If an charset is defined (by the contentType) use that, otherwise use a file reader

Specified by:
getReader in interface ContentStream
Overrides:
getReader in class ContentStreamBase
Throws:
IOException
